Reviews.Title: Not good, even at a low price
Reviews.Author: Cas Walker
Reviews.Content: My first day working on the NP355E5C and it's not as slow as I feared it would be. It has a low end AMD processor so I was worried it would be annoyingly slow to use. So far I've installed Windows updates and ClassicShell to make Windows 8 usable and performance has been ok.The 5400rpm 500GB Hitachi hard drive with 8MB cache is a pretty standard part for inexpensive laptops and it's kinda slow. If this was my daily use computer I'd be tempted to upgrade it to an SSD drive.I was surprised such an inexpensive PC has Realtek gigabit for wired ethernet and it has bluetooth in addition to two USB 3 ports and two USB 2 ports. That's better connectivity options than other low end laptops.The screen is bright and clear. I'm not a touch typist but the keyboard is working well for me.The trackpad has frequently quit tracking my finger until I lift off and put my finger back down. I've not found any setting in the control panel that helps.Update 04mar13: I'd hoped I could find a way to add Windows7 but this laptop uses "Secure Boot" making it difficult and expensive to get Windows 7 installed. It looks like I would have to turn off Secure Boot then reformat the hard drive and reinstall Windows7 from scratch with a retail Win 7 disk. It appears I would then loose the ability to use the provided Windows8 installation. Think I'm stuck with Win8. I'm using Classic Shell to help make Win8 more usable. That makes it pretty much like Win7 but still a little weird. On the upside, every program and tweak I use in Win7 is working in Win8 so that's cool. I'm still having the problem where the trackpad stops responding until I lift my finger. I'm getting used to doing that but I hope someday a driver update will help with that issue.Update 08jul13: Downgraded from 4 stars to 1 star. I've given up on this thing. The trackpad has never tracked right. I tried driver updates & setting changes but cannot get it to work smoothly. I have to use a mouse. Then one day the screen went solid white then solid black. I could only see the desktop when I plugged in an external monitor. I called Samsung and set up a warranty service return to get the screen fixed but after a few days and many reboots the screen started working again so I had to cancel the return. The screen has worked perfectly ever since but I no longer trust this laptop to be reliable for travel. This past week I noticed the CPU is always working at half speed, .8GHz instead of 1.7GHz. Turns out the power plan keeps reverting to the Power Saver plan after I set it to the Performance plan. I can't find a way to get the Performance power plan setting to stick.I like Samsung, they make a lot of price/performance winning stuff. I wanted to like this laptop, but with the poorly performing trackpad, the unreliable screen, & the CPU speed issue, this laptop is just too frustrating.UPDATE September 2013:I've now sent this thing in for repair three times. First for blank screen, erratic trackpad, and camera not working. They fixed the screen and sent it back with the camera & trackpad problems. So I sent it in a second time and again they fixed only one problem, the camera, and sent it back to me. Now its in for service a third time and hopefully they'll fix the trackpad this time.They are fixing the problems but its been a slow frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: Seems perfect
Reviews.Author: Devrie K. Paradowski
Reviews.Content: It is taking us a bit of time to get used to the new Windows format; however, the machine is pretty quick.  I'm not a techie, so specifics, i can't give.  I got this computer primarily because my daughter loves to create animated videos with Windows Movie Maker while listening to a constant stream of music from Youtube and chatting with friends on Facebook.  Works well for that.

Reviews.Title: So far...So good!
Reviews.Author: Melody Collins
Reviews.Content: I received my laptop promptly and am in love with it so far.  The only thing I have to complain about is getting used to Windows 8!  LOL but the laptop hasn't given my any problems so far.  It isn't too heavy to carry. The sound is clear, and the display is bright and clear. I am in love with it at this point...ask me again in 6 months or a year. :)

Reviews.Title: computer is fine
Reviews.Author: steven zahorik
Reviews.Content: laptop is great except for the fact there is no touch screen  for the windows8, otherwise its fine from the desktop icon.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Yandree
Reviews.Content: works justt fine, it's a very nice pc... It feels fine, nice touch and works very good, and it have a low price

Reviews.Title: Faulty
Reviews.Author: Brad Anderson
Reviews.Content: Product was very light and with good battery life. Design looked neat and programs ran fast with win 8. However the keyboard did not function properly out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Computer stopped working after 2 days
Reviews.Author: Marc Herzog
Reviews.Content: There was no recovery software or even a copy of windows 8 in the box.  Samsung was useless other than to tell me to send the laptop back to them and they will take a look at it in 14-21 days... I haven't even owned it that long.

Reviews.Title: Hey
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: Love this computer ... They said its new but it came with a different persons name. So its referb but it is worth it..Im smillin great computer they got it to me within a week..

Reviews.Title: Great looking
Reviews.Author: Jennilen
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with the laptop itself and I'm sure I'll eventually get used to it.  I'm just one of those people who are totally lost with Windows 8 and I'm tech savvy.....

Reviews.Title: wrost laptop ever
Reviews.Author: saysavanh
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this laptop, it's slow, freezes up on you, and the windows 8 system is not all that great. The apps for the windows 8 seems like a great concept but it doesn't work 3/4 of the times and the internet connection keeps cutting out

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Internet Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my first Samsung product.Samsung seems to have a good reputation for TV's and cell phones and other electronics.So I bit on this one.  Fortunately paid only $249.00 new.Replaced my Toshiba Vista laptop.Well, Windows 8 is awful.  But that has nothing to do with this laptop (I think).This laptop is a bottom budget laptop and it really shows.All of the components are minimal or marginal.  It is a laptop.  That's it.Reading up on the CPU apparently the Intel Celeron is a better CPU then this AMD in this Samsung laptop.This Samsung laptop is slow and clunky.  I use cable broadband from two different companies in two different states. No, not at the same time.Actually got a new router and broadband modem at one place as I thought issues might be there.  No it is this laptop.Got a black screen once and nothing I could do would get the screen to show up.  Finally after multiple attempts manual on/off unplug etc.  did get screen back.  This has never happened with my previous 3 laptops. Different brands.This laptop does have a good amount of RAM and an HDMI port.I have had this laptop for over a year now.  Only use rarely but for long periods of time when I do.I can't recommend this laptop.I actually reformatted the hard drive (back to out of box) as I thought maybe some software I had on this was causing issues.Note:  For those looking for the reformat disk - it is not there.  The reformat is built into the software of this Samsung laptop. No disk required.  All in on the software built into this Samsung laptop.I will dump this laptop once Microsoft comes out with Windows 9 or whatever the next full version is. I will make sure to check the processor before purchasing any low end laptop.  My last laptop was a low end Toshiba and that worked better then this newer Samsung with same internet connections and mostly same programs.Take a step up and skip over this Samsung and this AMD processor.Samsung missed the boat with this laptop and Samsung has tarnished it's reputation.

Reviews.Title: Review still in progess
Reviews.Author: say2juicy
Reviews.Content: It's a good product so far. Only problem I had was trying to figure out how to use windows 8. Still in progress.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat disappointed
Reviews.Author: dynamic mom
Reviews.Content: At first the laptop was great. I haven't even had it that long and it constantly is updating and when doing this it always says "failure to update"! A brand new computer shouldn't be having problems updating so now I guess it is time to contact SamsungWindows 8 I am still learning but starting to get the hang of it. My space bar also will squeak once in a while too.Overall it isn't that bad of a laptop but I was expecting something a little bit better from Samsung

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Becky Matthews
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this laptop and having a 2nd laptop is great I use it for my to go laptop and my other laptop as my personal laptop and this is one is great.

Reviews.Title: Lack of attetion on delivery
Reviews.Author: Lourenco Tembo
Reviews.Content: I did not like this product because the seller gave me the wrong and used one instead of a brand new that I ordered and beside this, I cannot access to it because is blocked by MATEO RODRIGUEZ that I never meet before and I do not know why this MATEO RODRIGUEZ is on this PC and asking me for a password. I do not remomend someone to buy any item from this seller. I am sorry.

Reviews.Title: Get's the job done
Reviews.Author: Ms "loyal amazon customer"
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for anything more or less...does what I bought it for & that's for my kids to do their school assignments

Reviews.Title: my samsung
Reviews.Author: Brandi Marshall
Reviews.Content: I love my samsung laptop! Although the cord broke within a couple days of getting the customer service was great! They credited me $30 to buy a new one.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Marisela Villegas
Reviews.Content: Excellent product i highly recommend very good.i loved it. What we wanted. Very good everything I expected. comprenlo - guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: Thank you
Reviews.Author: Khayal Sadikhov
Reviews.Content: Thank you. It's really a great item. Perfect deal and great price. Works very good - pretty cool laptop - I'm satisfied

Reviews.Title: This is a good buy trust me I was scared at first but it's faster than I thought and it's a brand new kind of computer
Reviews.Author: Michael Souffrant
Reviews.Content: This is a good buy trust me I was scared at first but it's faster than I thought and it's a brand new kind of computer so you will enjoy the exploration

Reviews.Title: good for the money
Reviews.Author: sonny4fn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this new for under 300. I did have some problems with it locking up but windows updates seem to have taken care of that. I downsized from a quad core hp so it does seem slower than that machine was. all in all I am happy with it for the money. I have seen it online for alot more and I wouldn't have paid that.

Reviews.Title: Buy another
Reviews.Author: GoldenFlash
Reviews.Content: I am extremely unhappy with this purchase. I have to wait 15-20 minutes every time the computer wakes up or gets turned on before the wireless internet decides to work. Then it will cut out at any given time which you will have to wait until the computer decides to start receiving from the internet again. I would strongly suggest getting a different laptop because this will give you more headaches than you have Tylenol.

Reviews.Title: It's Good
Reviews.Author: Demone Hawkins
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about 2 months now. It's a pretty good computer, my only complaints are that it's not that fast and that the usb ports are too close together which means I can't use both at the sametime. Other than that I like for the price.

Reviews.Title: slow performer
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: computer is slow. not sure if it is windows8 or the hardware. 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: jnbmom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop back in April and it has stopped playing DVDs a few weeks ago. The DVD somehow became stuck in the laptop and was so well hidden that my husband kept insisting that there was no DVD stuck in there. We have since got the DVD out. Needless to say, it will not play DVDs. I had only had the laptop for 3 months before the disk drive gave out.Something that also bothers me about this laptop is that it loses wireless connectivity or does not even pick up the signal while other computers right next to me are able to. It is also terribly slow. I also TRULY dislike the operating system which is Windows 8. Every time Windows comes out with a new operating system, I read that people do not like it but I usually do not have any problems with new operating systems. THIS time, I DO have a problem with windows 8. I still do not understand how to use the system and am so frustrated by it. If Amazon replaces my laptop, I plan on having a computer person change it to Windows 7.****UPDATE February 10, 2014I contacted Samsung and am in the process of returning the laptop as it no longer turns on. I have to pay the shipping costs to get it to Samsung but they, supposedly, pay for the shipping to return it, or its replacement, back to me.

Reviews.Title: too busy doing needless items to be a computer!
Reviews.Author: Z. Ellis "Z-rock"
Reviews.Content: Spend your money better. This item tries to to be an APP driven device. So it ends up doing anything really really slow. Even just internet is a pack a lunch ordeal. I highly resent the fact that I purchased an item that comes already burdened with advertisements. I would only recommend this item to people I dislike a lot.

Reviews.Title: laptop
Reviews.Author: lorihartz
Reviews.Content: this laptop is great!  I do like windows 8 AS IT IS LIKE MY WIN smartphone.  WIN 8 operating system was so easy to learn!  I do believe though that if you do not use a mouse than WIN 8 does frustrate you because it does switch screens back and forth too easily and when you do not want it to, (NOT SO WHEN USING A MOUSE)! This computer is slower so if you want it for business purposes you may want a faster processor and more memory but for an everyday laptop computer this one meets all the requirements!  also in WIN 8 it is so much  easier to install and uninstall programs and apps than in WIN7! People who complain about WIN8 are probably the high tech people who learned WIN7 completely or dummies (like me) don't want to take the time to learn WIN8!  Just give WIN8 2 weeks and you will begin to like it!

ProductInfo.Features:
AMD Dual Core E2-1800 Accelerated 1.7GHz 1MB Cache Processor
4GB DDR3 1600MHz Memory, Expandable to 8GB
500GB 5400RPM SATA2 Hard Drive
15.6" HD LED Display (1366 x 768), 1.3MP HD Webcam, HDMI, USB 2.0
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung NP355E5C-A01US Laptop (1.7GHz AMD Dual Core E2-1800 Accelerated 1.7GHz Processor, 4GB Ram, 500GB hard drive, Windows 8)
